Posts.Content: Apr 22, 2012 09:27PM shopejones wrote: Cindyl than you for commenting.  I am going to have a bilateral MX I don't know the acronyms yet, chemo, possible pre-chemo.  Will find out this week.  I am just trying to get all those ducks in a row so to speak and it is so hard when I have been the one to keep everyone in care, comfort and organized.  This cancer is teaching me so much about myself and how much I can no longer carry in life as I did pre-c. Breathe.  That is what I keep telling myself, just breathe and pray all will reveal itself.
Posts.Title: Just Diagnosed Infiltrating Ductal Carcinoma shopejones shopejones

Posts.Content: Apr 22, 2012 09:11PM shopejones wrote: Oh ValFal thank you for your comments.  I am so frustrated this evening but trying to release that and find gratitude.  My Mom arrived and is telling me I need to write 10 years of my vegan culinary skills down so they can make the proper food for me.  My head is spinnig because she seems to think 4 weeks tops and and I done with this.  My husband hasn't been home enough due to career to even know where the forks are let alone make a meal.  They are trying but I am so overwhelmed with the need for nurturing, organizing, not sure where to let go and let be and to truly help now before I am not able.  I am also fighting a horrible congestive cough and cold.  Oh the timing of things.  I am so sorry we have to meet here but like you so thankful for this place.  Be well~
Posts.Title: Just Diagnosed Infiltrating Ductal Carcinoma shopejones shopejones

Posts.Content: shopejones wrote: So here I am.  I am 37 and have been pointing out and complaining for 4 years about the spot I was mammoed on, ultrasound, and told too young don't worry, carry on.  Now I complained louder, in a new town, know no one, and got heard.  Stage 2 IFC, had MRI today, results tomorrow, have a 2.5 year old angel and a husband who is a Commander in the Navy (job uncertain now because of this diagnosis).  We just moved to our new location 2 months ago (husband just got here last week) and have no network and finding that when I have reached out to all those friends and (what little family we each have) I am getting tons of resources shot my way (for which I accept with gratitude) but I am not finding that one or few who will hold my hand through this and my head when the worst of it hits.  We are feeling stretched thin and this whirlwind is a wild ride already.  I finally slept for 2 hours after not for 2 days and got on here. I biggest concern is my daughter.  Knowing barely where to go get our groceries right now (and I am a serious researcher and get things done kind of gal) I am trying to find that angel of light that will care for her and be able to handle what our family has to go through.  My daughter has never been away from me for longer than an hour and that has only been a handful of times.  We co-sleep (prepping now for that to change) but she is such a senstive, way too aware little soul that needs just the right nurturer to care for her.  It all scares me but mostly having to open up and trust strangers.  I am trying to step back and trust our military system, having put my 'feelers' out to friends around the world and release my planner, controlling self and hope this will all just play itself out.  Trying to "prep" for so much unknown is wearing me down and Tough as Nails girl I am this stuff (IDC) is in me and I need to rest, let go breathe.  How do I do that and 'get ready'? Shannon Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Just Diagnosed Infiltrating Ductal Carcinoma shopejones shopejones
